intro: Aeginetia indica var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender sea holly, is a coastal plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, blue-green leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens.
